title: Understanding Hallucinations
text: Hallucinations are sensory experiences that appear real but are created by your mind. They can affect all five of your senses.

title: Types of Hallucinations
text: Hallucinations can involve seeing, hearing, feeling, tasting, or smelling things that are not present.

hintAnswer: the perception of sensory experiences without natural external stimuli
title: Identifying Hallucinations
text: Which of the following best describes a hallucination?
choices: a fixed false belief that cannot be changed in the mind of those who hold them despite evidence to the contrary
fixed false beliefs with content that is not reasonably possible in this world. They are strange, eccentric, and unrealistic
a fixed false belief containing content that is plausible but inconsistent with evidence
the perception of sensory experiences without natural external stimuli
